meanings.definition: A document that is printed before the final version is published.
meanings.sent1: I read a preprint of the report before it was officially released.
meanings.sent2: The preprint contained some errors that were corrected in the final version.
meanings.sent3: The preprint was like a sneak peek into the author's thoughts before the big reveal.
meanings.sent4: The preprint was a glimpse into the upcoming research findings.
meanings.sent5: The preprint gave us an early look at the study results.

meanings.definition: To print something before the final version is published.
meanings.sent1: The author decided to preprint the manuscript for feedback.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to preprint scientific papers for review.
meanings.sent3: She preprinted the invitations to ensure they were ready on time.
meanings.sent4: The company preprints brochures to distribute at the event.
meanings.sent5: He preprints his articles to gather input from colleagues.
